action: I want to create a new project and centrally manage members, budgets, and progress
reason: To visualize project status and prevent delivery delays and cost overruns
acceptance_criteria: Project creation is only possible for authenticated users.
The ability to create projects is restricted to the PM role or higher.
project_id is automatically numbered and unique.
The project name is a mandatory input.
The maximum length of the project name is 150 characters.
The project description is limited to 1,000 characters.
Descriptions are sanitized for XSS countermeasures.
Start and end dates are stored as date types.
The end date cannot be set before the start date.
Status is restricted to Planning / Active / OnHold / Completed / Cancelled.
Invalid status values cannot be saved.
The budget amount is managed as a numeric type.
Budgets less than 0 are not permitted.
Currency types are managed via master data.
The project owner user_id is mandatory.
Non-existent user IDs cannot be specified.
Multiple members can be assigned to a project.
Permission checks are performed when adding members.
Duplicate addition of the same user is prohibited.
Member change history is maintained.
Per-project role settings are possible.
A progress rate (0â€“100%) field exists.
Registration of progress exceeding 100% is not allowed.
History is saved whenever progress is updated.
Budget consumption is automatically calculated.
A warning flag is raised when the budget is exceeded.
Project deletion is implemented as a logical delete.
Deletion is only possible by the administrator or the owner.
Audit logs are stored upon deletion.
The same validation applies to creation via API.
DB access uses parameterized queries.
CSRF countermeasures are enabled.
HTTPS communication is mandatory.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
Successful project creation logs are stored.
Project change logs are stored.
Logs include the operating user ID.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Concurrent update conflicts are detected via optimistic locking.
Updates fail if the version does not match.
Supports bulk creation via CSV import.
CSV data is subject to the same validation rules.
Target API response time is within 500ms.
The API is REST-compliant.
Data is unified in UTF-8.
A notification event is issued upon project completion.
Notifications are processed via an asynchronous queue.
Progress logs can be exported for reporting.
A project archiving function exists.
Archived projects are view-only and cannot be edited.
